definition: to apologize for an offense/to offer one's apology for a fault
to thank/to apologize/to wither (of flowers, leaves etc)/to decline
surname Xie
variant of 罪[zui4], crime
guilt/crime/fault/blame/sin

sentences.english: Jiangchuan for the failure of shame, she is going to cut abdomen to the emperor to malaysians.
sentences.chinese: 江川为这次的失败羞愧难当，她准备切腹向天皇谢罪。

sentences.english: Both to the people and sent into the oracle to address, male aggregates worship table malaysians.
sentences.chinese: 既至，遣人入交址谕以利害，公蕴拜表谢罪。

sentences.english: With so long a time in between, it is too late even to apologize.
sentences.chinese: 隔了这么久，恐怕连谢罪自谴的有效期也早过了吧？

sentences.english: Chinese fir without complaint, to die to malaysians to caesarean section.
sentences.chinese: 杉木毫无怨言，欲剖腹以死谢罪。

sentences.english: The reply has been delayed for so long that I’m afraid even a heartfelt apology has already lost its power.
sentences.chinese: 隔了这么久，恐怕连谢罪自谴的有效期也早过了吧。

definition: to apologize humbly/to beg forgiveness
to confess one's fault/to accept one's punishment
to plea for leniency/to ask for a favor
to kneel/to go down on one's knees
to kill oneself/suicide
to atone for one's crime/to buy freedom from punishment/redemption/atonement
insulted/humiliated/disgraced
to confess/to repent/remorse/repentance/penitent/confession (Buddhism)
to regret/to repent
harakiri (formal Japanese: seppuku), a samurai's suicide by disemboweling
variant of 服罪[fu2 zui4]
hara-kiri
lit. to bring a bramble and ask for punishment (idiom)/fig. to offer sb a humble apology
to denounce/to condemn/to call to account/to punish
to admit to a crime/to plead guilty
to sue for mercy/to ask for forgiveness/begging for magnanimity
